page.title: 16Living in Broome
page.content: I quite like living in Broome because it is out of the way of busy traffic and factories but, it has its disadvantages because none of my friends live in Broome. The children that do are much younger or older than me. I am 12. There are no shops (except for a rather expensive organic foods shop) and there are no clubs for children, so I go to Blakedown Church Youth Club on Tuesdays, but only if I get a lift in a car. In the winter we usually miss some School because all the snow blows off the fields in several metre high snow drifts and blocks our drive and the local lanes. Broome has 115 residents and is built around a triangle of lanes. It is thought to have been founded in 1154 when Henry II gave it as a gift to a nobleman and called it after the yellow broom shrub. (Pamela Pheysey)
